name: Employment sector of workers with a bachelor's degree or higher, by broad occupational category and degree field: 2019
description: Employment sector of workers with a bachelor's degree or higher, by broad occupational category and degree field: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_all_employed_non_scientists_and_engineers
variableMeasured.description: All Employed Non Scientists And Engineers

variableMeasured.name: field_all_employed_scientists_and_engineers_highest_degree_in_s_e
variableMeasured.description: All Employed Scientists And Engineers Highest Degree In S E

variableMeasured.name: field_all_employed_scientists_and_engineers_s_e_occupations
variableMeasured.description: All Employed Scientists And Engineers S E Occupations

variableMeasured.name: field_all_employed_scientists_and_engineers_s_e_related_occupations
variableMeasured.description: All Employed Scientists And Engineers S E Related Occupations

variableMeasured.name: field_all_employed_scientists_and_engineers_non_s_e_occupations
variableMeasured.description: All Employed Scientists And Engineers Non S E Occupations

notes: Scientists and engineers include those with one or more S&E or S&E-related degrees at the bachelor's level or higher or those who have only a non-S&E degree at the bachelor's level or higher and are employed in an S&E or S&E-related occupation. Detail may not add to total because of rounding, and percentages may not add to 100% because of rounding.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), 2019.Science and Engineering Indicators
